Message.Title: The Tegra, it is like elephant
Message.Msg: The Tegra, it is like elephant When small, it come and go from hut No one care It is cute Then Elephant grow bigger And bigger It smash hut of owner To eat roof Then neighbor's hut too Munch munch munch No roof Then smash half of village Eating roof after roof Munch munch munch munch munch munch Villagers get angry On so angry No like feeding roof to Elephant Paint faces and shout "Kill the Tegra" "Kill the Tegra" Wise council bosses order chief of village to kill Elephant Prosperity returns to village Lesson: Kill the Tegra before it smash and eat village For the six months ending July 29, 2012 the CPB (Tegra) Division reported the following results: $312.1 million __ CPB (Tegra) Revenues ($191.6) million __ CPB (Tegra) LOSSES Munch munch munch munch munch

Topic.Title: The Tegra, it is like elephant

Message.Msg: Did you just fall off another planet. Can you speak English?

Message.Title: And the wins keep coming! Another cray.
Message.Msg: "Big Red II will accelerate discovery and allow new research by hundreds of IU scientists and scholars right across the university including in medicine, biology, physics, chemistry, astronomy, network science, sustainability science, global climate research, public health, and, of course, informatics and computer science. It will also play a major role in the recruitment of new faculty in these and other areas who will make use of Big Red II and its huge data processing capabilities." The new system will be unique among supercomputers owned by U.S. universities. The new Cray will have more than 21,000 processor cores, high-performance GPUs, and an extremely fast Cray Gemini Interconnect. It will include the newest NVIDIA GPU accelerators and the latest AMD processors with 16 cores each. Big Red II represents a substantial capability leap forward for IU over Big Red's 4,100 cores. "We are excited and honored that Indiana University has selected a Cray supercomputer to become the next Big Red system," said Peter Ungaro, president and CEO of Cray Inc. "The university is widely known as a leader in the academic circles of high performance computing, and we look forward to collaborating with IU and providing their researchers, scientists and students with the unique performance and capability found only in a Cray."

Message.Title: Voter intimidation by republicans
Message.Msg: Westgate Resort's David Siegel says he will have to lay off workers and downsize his company -- or even shut it down. Is there nothing a Republicant won't stoop to! NAFR Sell the gold!

Informing employees of something that could very well happen is not voter intimidation. Given that Obama in 4 years has done very little to improve unemployment from the day he started, along with the unpopular healthcare reform bill that was forced through congress on Christmas Eve, he instills little confidence in the business community. The last debate has shown very clearly that Obama can't defend his record, and that Romney has a grasp on issues that Obama apparently lacks. You can't really expect much more from a political hack and community organizer from Chicago, one term state senator, and half term as U.S. senator.

Message.Title: It was holding $13 nicely until it wasn't right?
Message.Msg: Held $13 much better than it held $26, $25, $24, $23, ... and $16 didn't it? You know the twenties went by in a flash, right? Maybe it can hold $12 just as nicely as it held $13 hmm? lol Nvidia is junk. Is it sinking in yet? imho

so your saying the jobs situation is little improved when compared to where he started. When the economy was in total collapse when he got in to what is timid growth now. I cant agree with you on it being completely forced unless Obama had gone with the public option. What he pushed through was basically the republican plan that was there to counter the public option. Obama put it up and was completely opposed by them. Also the health care bill has become more and more popular as it takes effect. Their was a time Romney was saying get rid of it completely, now he's claiming to keep just the popular parts. Obama can defend his record but he was trying to play it safe by not pushing too hard in the debate and failed to to do so. He wound up doing the complete reverse of pushing too hard. The next debates should be much more interesting. Unfortunately what most Americans cared most about was the economy and that was that first debate. This will probably be a really tight race now. In terms of facts and figures. Obama did better. Romney lied/distorted the truth far more than him. Obama put more policies out on the table that he was willing to pursue. I heard very little from Romney. How many big birds would need to be taken on to add up to just the 2bil+ oil subsidies that Obama was willing to take on. It was all in the presentation and Obama did lousy in that debate. Some stuff Obama has done- Lilly Ledbetter Fair Pay act Cash For Clunkers Don't Ask Don't Tell policy removed Bin laden dead Health care law Much much more...

Obama is not a very good debater. It's not very presidential to say after you lost miserably that your opponent lied. He had the same opportunity to object to the facts as Romney did. He's the damn President that should have enough onions to open his mouth at the time. Healthcare bill is still disliked by a majority of the people. It's another government run accident waiting to happen. Some stuff Obama has done- Lilly Ledbetter Fair Pay act - Let the market forces set pay, not the government. Cash For Clunkers - It was a failure that just moved up the purchases for people already looking and contemplating. The car market was dead a couple months later. Don't Ask Don't Tell policy removed - Should have left what Clinton signed. Bin laden dead - The forces were already in the field looking for him. He just had to give the go ahead. Health care law - Sucks big time. Will be repealed when Romney is elected, and if the GOP holds the house and controls the senate that they probably will do.
